channel.title: Digitized Orchard on
channel.description: Recent content in Digitized Orchard on

item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Folder Structure Here’s a rough overview of what’s what.

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, the following instructions guide you through installing the proper dependencies to run it locally.

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: Hosting on GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!

item.title: 2022-12-14 Balkans un nouveau Grand Jeu
item.description: Balkans : un nouveau Grand Jeu ? Le dossier que présente Politique étrangère [1] [1]Ce dossier a été réalisé en collaboration avec le Centre… s’efforce d’appréhender l’espace balkanique dans ses composantes stratégiques, locales et régionales.

item.title: 2022-12-14 Configurer Postfix pour bloquer en entrée les faux emails semblant provenir de mon domaine
item.description: Configurer Postfix pour bloquer en entrée les faux emails semblant provenir de mon domaine Quand j’ai reçu un énième email semblant émaner de ma propre adresse emails et me réclamant du pognon pour ne pas dévoiler que je me pignole sur du porn, je me suis dit que, quand même, il doit exister un moyen de bloquer ça sans recourir à un antispam.

item.title: 2022-12-14 How to Use Obsidian Dataview A Complete Beginners Guide – A Non-technical Guide
item.description: How to Use Obsidian Dataview: A Complete Beginners Guide – A Non-technical Guide Obsidian dataview is one of the most widely used community plugins in obsidian.

item.title: 2022-12-14 I still dont care about cookies
item.description: I still don’t care about cookies The EU regulations require that any website using tracking cookies must get user’s permission before installing them.

item.title: 2022-12-14 What is Codon
item.description: What is Codon? Codon is a high-performance Python compiler that compiles Python code to native machine code without any runtime overhead.
[[2022-12-15 Andrew Sutherland]] [[- InternetScrap]]

item.title: 2022-12-15 Andrew Sutherland
item.description: Hi Friend! Welcome to asuth.com. I built this website so you can get to know me a bit. I’m in a goofy and exploratory phase of my life.
[[2022-12-16 Penser la stratégie. La dialectique des milieux stratégiques]] [[2022-12-16 Comment convertir un MP3 en fichier MIDI]] [[- InternetScrap]]

item.title: 2022-12-16 Comment convertir un MP3 en fichier MIDI
item.description: Si comme moi, vous faites de la production musicale (mon Soundcloud est ici si vous voulez écouter), vous cherchez peut-être à récupérer les notes d’un certain morceau afin de le remixer, sampler ou que sais-je encore (Genre en faire une sonnerie pour votre smartphone ^^) Et bien, ne cherchez plus puisqu’il y a un formidable outil en ligne qui en plus d’être open source, est clairement un niveau au-dessus des outils (merdiques) similaires que vous avez déjà dû tester.

item.title: 2022-12-16 Penser la stratégie. La dialectique des milieux stratégiques
item.description: Dans les années 1960, General Electric et McKinsey développent le concept de « segmentation stratégique ». Il s’agit de fractionner une entreprise en « Domaines d’activité stratégique » (DAS) et d’identifier la meilleure stratégie spécifique possible pour chacun de ces « domaines » (1).

item.description: Es ist der Weihnachtsklassiker schlechthin – und rangiert auch aktuell auf Platz 2 der Schweizer Hitparade: «Last Christmas» von Wham!

item.title: 2022-12-17 Chris Aldrich BoffoSocko
item.description: As a member of the IndieWeb movement/community, I follow many of their principles including owning all of my own data by publishing it on my own website.

item.title: 2022-12-17 How can we develop transformative tools for thought
item.description: In this essay we sketch out a set of ideas we believe can be used to help develop transformative new tools for thought.

item.title: 2022-12-17 Le général Burkhard tord le cou à l’idée d’une armée européenne
item.description: « Faut-il une armée européenne? La question est sous-jacente quand on évoque l’Europe de la Défense et ma réponse sera factuelle : décider d’engager des militaires en opération, c’est décider que des gens peuvent mourir et donner la mort.

item.title: 2022-12-17 Medieval helpdesk with English subtitles
item.description: Helpdesk support back in the day of the middle age with English subtitles. Original taken from the show “Øystein og jeg” on Norwegian Broadcasting (NRK)in 2001.

item.title: 2022-12-17 My Obsidian People Note Template
item.description: I recently shared the template that I created for my Daily Notes, and many people found it useful. As a follow up, I wanted to share how I manage people in my Obsidian universe.

item.title: 2022-12-25 La carte Churchill, une carte qui ne devrait pas exister
item.description: #stratégie [[- ReadItLater]] [[- Article]] [[- InternetScrap]] [[- Strategie]] La « carte Churchill », une carte qui ne devrait pas exister En 2021, une carte du Service topographique national accompagnée de mentions manuscrites a été découverte dans l’ancienne résidence de campagne de Winston Churchill (1874-1965).

item.description: [[- InternetScrap]] [[- ReadItLater]] [[- Article]] LUKS, VeraCrypt, CryFS, EncFS, gocryptfs…? A practical discussion on sync of encrypting files This article provides a brief discussion of the types of cryptography available at the ‘day to day’ level and the implications of its use, both locally and in the cloud.

item.title: 2022-12-26 SiriKali works on Linux, macOS and Microsoft Windows Operating Systems
item.description: [[- InternetScrap]] [[- ReadItLater]] [[- Article]] SiriKali works on Linux, macOS and Microsoft Windows Operating Systems SiriKali is a Qt/C++ GUI application that manages ecryptfs, cryfs, encfs, gocryptfs, fscrypt and securefs based encrypted folders.

item.title: Callouts
item.description: Callout support Quartz supports the same Admonition-callout syntax as Obsidian. This includes 12 Distinct callout types (each with several aliases) Collapsable callouts See documentation on supported types and syntax here.

item.title: CJK + Latex Support (测试)
item.description: Chinese, Japanese, Korean Support 几乎在我们意识到之前，我们已经离开了地面。 우리가 그것을 알기도 전에 우리는 땅을 떠났습니다. 私たちがそれを知るほぼ前に、私たちは地面を離れていました。 Latex Block math works with two dollar signs $$.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step.

item.title: Hosting with Docker
item.description: If you want to host Quartz on a machine without using a webpage hosting service, it may be easier to install Docker Compose and follow the instructions below than to install Quartz’s dependencies manually.

item.title: I Found a Loophole to (Successfully) Web Scrape Using ChatGPT. Here’s How it Works
item.description: [[- ReadItLater]] [[- Article]] [[- InternetScrap]] [[-AI]] I Found a Loophole to (Successfully) Web Scrape Using ChatGPT. Here’s How it Works Scrape any website with ChatGPT using this approach (demo with Amazon and Twitter) Photo by Mikhail Nilov on Pexels

item.title: Ignoring Notes
item.description: Quartz Ignore Edit ignoreFiles in config.toml to include paths you’d like to exclude from being rendered. 1 2 3 4 5 6 .

item.title: LaTest
item.description: Block math works with two dollar signs $$f(x) = \int_{-\infty}^\infty f\hat(\xi),e^{2 \pi i \xi x},d\xi$$ Inline math also works with single dollar signs For example, Euler’s identity but inline: $e^{i\pi} = -1$

item.title: Quartz Philosophy
item.description: “[One] who works with the door open gets all kinds of interruptions, but [they] also occasionally gets clues as to what the world is and what might be important.

item.title: Search
item.description: Quartz supports two modes of searching through content. Full-text Full-text search is the default in Quartz. It produces results that exactly match the search query.

item.title: Showcase
item.description: Want to see what Quartz can do? Here are some cool community gardens :) Quartz Documentation (this site!) Jacky Zhao’s Garden Scaling Synthesis - A hypertext research notebook AWAGMI Intern Notes Shihyu’s PKM Chloe’s Garden SlRvb’s Site Course notes for Information Technology Advanced Theory Brandon Boswell’s Garden Siyang’s Courtyard Data Dictionary 🧠 sspaeti.

item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :)

item.title: Updating
item.description: Haven’t updated Quartz in a while and want all the cool new optimizations? On Unix/Mac systems you can run the following command for a one-line update!
